columns.text: In this problem, we are required to prepare common-size balance sheets for Just Dew It.

Before we begin, let us first define balance sheet.

**Common-size Balance Sheet** is a balance sheet that shows both the numeric value and percentage for total assets, total liabilities, and equity accounts.

The 2017 common-size balance sheet for Just Dew It Corporation would look like this:

$$ 
\bold{Just~Dew~It~Corporation}\\ 
\bold{Balance~Sheet}\\ 
\bold{For~ the ~Year~ Ended~ 2017}\\ $$

$$\begin{array}{cccc}\\
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Cash}&&&\text{\$12,157} &&& 2.62\%\\
&\text{Accounts Receivable}&&&\text{29,382}&&& 6.34\%\\
&\text{Inventory}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~~~54,632}}&&& 11.79\%\\
&\text{Current~Assets}&&&{\$~96,171}\\ \\

&\text{Net plant and equipment}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~~~367,241}}&&& 79.25\%\\
&\bold{Total~Assets}&&&{\boxed{\bold{\$~463,412}}}&&& 100.00\%\\ \\

&\text{Accounts Payable}&&&\$46,382&&& 10.01\%\\ 
&\text{Notes Payable}&&&\underline{~~~~~~~~~~18,246}&&& 3.94\%\\
&\text{Current~Liabilities}&&&\$~64,628\\ \\

&\text{Long-term debt}&&&\underline{~~~~~~~~~~49,000}&&&10.57\%\\
&\text{Total~Liabilities}&&&\$~113,628\\ \\

&\text{Common stock and paid-in capital}&&&\$~50,000&&& 10.79\%\\ 
&\text{Retained earnings}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~299,784 }}&&& 64.69\%\\
&\text{Total~Owners' Equity}&&&\$~349,784\\ \\

&\bold{Total~Liabilities~and~Equity}&&&{\boxed{\bold{\$~463,412}}}&&&100.00\%
\end{aligned}
\end{array}$$

&\text{Inventory}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~~~57,204}}&&& 11.92\%\\
&\text{Current~Assets}&&&{\$~104,124}\\ \\

&\text{Net plant and equipment}&&&\underline{\text{~~~~~~~~375,830}}&&& 78.30\%\\
&\bold{Total~Assets}&&&{\boxed{\bold{\$~479,954}}}&&& 100.00\%\\ \\

&\text{Accounts Payable}&&&\$49,276&&& 10.27\%\\ 
&\text{Notes Payable}&&&\underline{~~~~~~~~~~19,784}&&& 4.12\%\\
&\text{Current~Liabilities}&&&\$~69,060\\ \\

\end{aligned}
